questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: Jane has 6 flowers. She planted 3 more flowers. How many flowers does Jane have now?

content_zh.stem: Jane has 6 flowers. She planted 3 more flowers. How many flowers does Jane have now?

questions.explanation_en: Jane started with 6 flowers and planted 3 more. 6 + 3 = 9 flowers total.
questions.explanation_zh: Jane started with 6 flowers and planted 3 more. 6 + 3 = 9 flowers total.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question K1-MATH-001 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: Identify the three-dimensional shape shown in the image.

content_zh.stem: Identify the three-dimensional shape shown in the image.

questions.explanation_en: The shape shown is a cylinder — it has two circular bases and a curved surface connecting them.
questions.explanation_zh: The shape shown is a cylinder — it has two circular bases and a curved surface connecting them.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question K1-MATH-002 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: According to the bar graph, which food was chosen by the fewest students?

content_zh.stem: According to the bar graph, which food was chosen by the fewest students?

questions.explanation_en: Reading the bar graph, hamburger has the shortest bar, meaning the fewest students chose it.
questions.explanation_zh: Reading the bar graph, hamburger has the shortest bar, meaning the fewest students chose it.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question K1-MATH-003 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math
questions.explanation_en: To find the missing number: 12 - 5 = 7. So 5 + 7 = 12.
questions.explanation_zh: To find the missing number: 12 - 5 = 7. So 5 + 7 = 12.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question K1-MATH-004 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math
questions.explanation_en: The pattern increases by 2 each time: 10, 12, 14, 16, 18, 20.
questions.explanation_zh: The pattern increases by 2 each time: 10, 12, 14, 16, 18, 20.

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: Count the stars: ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★. How many stars are there?

content_zh.stem: Count the stars: ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★ ★. How many stars are there?

questions.explanation_en: Counting each star one by one gives us 13 stars.
questions.explanation_zh: Counting each star one by one gives us 13 stars.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question K1-MATH-101 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: There are 15 birds sitting on a fence. 8 birds fly away. How many birds are still on the fence?

content_zh.stem: There are 15 birds sitting on a fence. 8 birds fly away. How many birds are still on the fence?

questions.explanation_en: 15 birds minus 8 that flew away: 15 - 8 = 7 birds are still on the fence.
questions.explanation_zh: 15 birds minus 8 that flew away: 15 - 8 = 7 birds are still on the fence.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question K1-MATH-102 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math
questions.explanation_en: 14 is greater than 9 because 14 comes after 9 when counting.
questions.explanation_zh: 14 is greater than 9 because 14 comes after 9 when counting.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question K1-MATH-103 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: How many sides does a triangle have?

content_zh.stem: How many sides does a triangle have?

questions.explanation_en: A triangle has exactly 3 sides. The prefix 'tri' means three.
questions.explanation_zh: A triangle has exactly 3 sides. The prefix 'tri' means three.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question K1-MATH-104 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: NASA's Artemis rocket carried 7 experiments on one trip and 6 experiments on the next trip to the Moon. How many experiments were carried in total?

content_zh.stem: NASA's Artemis rocket carried 7 experiments on one trip and 6 experiments on the next trip to the Moon. How many experiments were carried in total?

questions.source_detail: MAP-style question K1-MATH-105 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: What comes next in the pattern? Circle, Square, Circle, Square, Circle, ___

content_zh.stem: What comes next in the pattern? Circle, Square, Circle, Square, Circle, ___

questions.explanation_en: The pattern alternates between Circle and Square. After Circle, the next shape is Square.
questions.explanation_zh: The pattern alternates between Circle and Square. After Circle, the next shape is Square.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question K1-MATH-106 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: The cat is ON the table. The dog is UNDER the table. Where is the cat?

content_zh.stem: The cat is ON the table. The dog is UNDER the table. Where is the cat?

questions.explanation_en: The sentence says 'The cat is ON the table,' so the cat is on top of the table.
questions.explanation_zh: The sentence says 'The cat is ON the table,' so the cat is on top of the table.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question K1-MATH-107 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: Which of these does NOT belong in a group of round objects?

content_zh.stem: Which of these does NOT belong in a group of round objects?

questions.explanation_en: A basketball, orange, and marble are all round. A box is not round — it has flat sides and corners.
questions.explanation_zh: A basketball, orange, and marble are all round. A box is not round — it has flat sides and corners.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question K1-MATH-108 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: A ball is shaped like which 3D shape?

content_zh.stem: A ball is shaped like which 3D shape?

questions.explanation_en: A ball is perfectly round in all directions, which is the shape of a sphere.
questions.explanation_zh: A ball is perfectly round in all directions, which is the shape of a sphere.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question K1-MATH-109 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)

questions.subject: math

content_en.stem: Put these numbers in order from smallest to largest: 18, 4, 11. Which is the correct order?

content_zh.stem: Put these numbers in order from smallest to largest: 18, 4, 11. Which is the correct order?

questions.explanation_en: From smallest to largest: 4 < 11 < 18. The correct order is 4, 11, 18.
questions.explanation_zh: From smallest to largest: 4 < 11 < 18. The correct order is 4, 11, 18.
questions.source_detail: MAP-style question K1-MATH-110 (TestPrep-Online seed + AI expansion)
